page.title: 04 SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: In the Greenisland area is a{Grammar {school}(Belfast H.S.) for pupils from 11_18 years.It is attended mainly by the 30% selected by the 11+ exam. Many parents send their children to grammar schools further afield for reasons of religion, family tradition, boarding or requiring a single sex school. The other 70% of {secondary pupils} must travel to Downshire H.S. or St. Nicholas'H.S. in Carrickfergus.These schools provide less academic courses. Pupils may transfer to grammar or{ {technical schools}or leave at 16. { }Families in the area are fortunate at having, within 2 miles,{special {schools}for the blind,deaf and those in need of remedial teaching. Nearby,the{Jordanstown Campus of the {N.U.U.}offers a wide range of courses to those who attain the required grade at the A level public examination.
